title: Restore ML Enterprise logo assets, header/footer branding, and favicon

requirements.summary: Add optimized ML Enterprise logo and favicon static assets at the exact public paths already referenced by the app.
acceptanceCriteria: The following files exist in the deployed build at these exact public paths: /assets/generated/ml-enterprise-logo.dim_512x512.png, /assets/generated/ml-enterprise-logo.dim_128x128.png, /assets/generated/ml-enterprise-favicon.dim_32x32.png
The generated logo assets have a transparent background and appear as a crisp black wordmark on all standard displays

file_operations.description: Create/restore the 512x512 PNG logo asset (derived from LOGO-2.jpeg) with transparent background and crisp black wordmark at this exact path so existing references resolve.
Create/restore the 128x128 PNG logo asset (derived from LOGO-2.jpeg) with transparent background and crisp black wordmark at this exact path for any smaller-size usage.
Create/restore the 32x32 PNG favicon asset (simplified black logo mark on transparent background) at this exact path so existing favicon <link> references resolve.

requirements.summary: Ensure the header and footer render the ML Enterprise logo using the existing /assets/generated/ml-enterprise-logo.dim_512x512.png reference.
acceptanceCriteria: The logo is visible in the header (top-left) and footer brand block with no broken image icon
The logo image loads successfully (HTTP 200) from /assets/generated/ml-enterprise-logo.dim_512x512.png in the deployed build

file_operations.description: Verify/restore the header logo continues to reference exactly /assets/generated/ml-enterprise-logo.dim_512x512.png and renders reliably (no broken src), without changing navigation/structure beyond what is necessary.

Verify/restore the footer brand block logo continues to reference exactly /assets/generated/ml-enterprise-logo.dim_512x512.png and renders reliably (no broken src), without changing navigation/structure beyond what is necessary.

requirements.summary: Ensure the favicon loads correctly via the existing reference in frontend/index.html to /assets/generated/ml-enterprise-favicon.dim_32x32.png.
acceptanceCriteria: Browser tab shows the favicon when loading the app
/assets/generated/ml-enterprise-favicon.dim_32x32.png is present and returns HTTP 200 in the deployed build

file_operations.description: Verify/restore the existing favicon <link> tags reference exactly /assets/generated/ml-enterprise-favicon.dim_32x32.png so the browser tab favicon loads correctly in the deployed build.
